result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript:  October 3, 2022 Plea and Sentencing
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

ADDRESS INFO for CHRISTOPHER J MARVIN
Current: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 175 E. Liberty St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States

3:20 PM Defendant CHRISTOPHER J MARVIN in court.  Attorney J. Steven Heil in court for CHRISTOPHER J MARVIN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2021CF104, 2021CM135, 2022CF55 & 2022CF117. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 as charged  in 2021CF104 with prison and costs; and will plea to count 1 as charged in 2022CF117 with a concurrent prison sentence and all other counts/cases will be dismissed and read-in and Defense is free to argue. ADA concurs, Atty Heil concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged in 2021CF104 and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in. In 2022CF117, Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in. Court orders 2021CM135 & 2022CF55 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Atty Heil states the defendant is waiving his right to a PSI. State is waiving a PSI. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Heil. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF104 (Count 2) / 2022CF117 (Count 1) - EACH:

5 years WSP, with 3 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision, concurrent to each other and is to commence immediately.

CONDITIONS: (each)

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Court Courts. To be paid during the first year of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Court grants no sentence credit at this time, but if any credit is due, it can be put in writing to the Court.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 3:42 PM

Note: Per Judge after court, the Court costs - Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
SPD Update

2:29 PM Defendant CHRISTOPHER J MARVIN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney J. Steven Heil in court for CHRISTOPHER J MARVIN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF55 and 2022CF117. Atty Heil states they have a resolution on all cases. Statement by Atty Heil - requests bond be amended to a signature bond on 2022CF55. Statement by ADA. Statement by the Court - would not have any issue amending bond and makes statement to Atty Heil. Court questions defendant regarding waiver of prelim. Defendant concurs. 2022CF55 & 2022CF117-Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files the informations with the court, both are same as the criminal complaints. Attorney Heil acknowledges receipt of the informations and waives any reading. Atty Heil enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will convert the bond in 2022CF55 to a signature bond and all other conditions remain.  

Court adjourned at 2:34 PM

Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on October 3, 2022 at 3:00 PM - writ to be done.
